answers.answer: Hi,How is your wife? Foggy or blurred vision may be attributed to a lot of eye issues such as cataract or glaucoma. If there existing diabetes, diabetic retinopathy is also possible. Other potential causes of vision problems include fatigue or medications.It is important that direct clinical examination is done for proper evaluation and to rule out optic neuritis or TIA.   DIagnotic tests like slit-lamp examination, refraction test and tonometry are essential in reaching a diagnosis. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: 10 Days ago my wife vision on the right eye went foggy, this also came with pain above the right eye than comes every 10 - 12 hours.  There were no signs of infection except before 3 days, little reddish.  The pain is now coming and going and we are using pain killers waiting to see a physician next week.  What could be the cause of such sudden fog in vision and the pain above the eye.
title: Sudden Foggy vision and Pain
